datafield.subfield: Institute of Astronomy, University of Zielona Góra, ul. Lubuska 2, 65-001 Zielona Góra, Poland
Interdisciplinary Center for Mathematical and Computational Modeling, University of Warsaw, ul. Pawińskiego 5a, 02-106 Warsaw, Poland
Institute for Computational Cosmology, Department of Physics, Durham University, Science Laboratories, South Rd, Durham DH1 3LE, U.K.
Dark Matter haloes as probes of modified gravity
DM haloes and their environment in the fifth-force cosmology
DM haloes in the fifth-force cosmology
Postp oned to further consultations with co-authors
Published in JCAP (Issue 10, article id. 012, pp. 2013),32 pages (JCAP format), 13 figures, major revision version, some conclusions changed

We investigate how long-range scalar interactions affect the properties of dark matter haloes. For doing so we employ the ReBEL model which implements an additional interaction between dark matter particles. On the phenomenological level this is equivalent to a modification of gravity. We analyse the differences between five ReBEL models and $\Lambda$CDM using a series of high resolution cosmological simulations. Emphasis is placed on investigating how halo properties change in the presence of a fifth force. We report that the density profile of ReBEL haloes is well described by the NFW profile but with mean concentrations from $5\%$ to a few times higher than the standard $\Lambda$CDM value. We also find a slight increase of the halo spin for haloes more massive than $5\times10^{11}\M_{\odot}$, reflecting a higher rotational support of those haloes due to scalar forces. In addition, the dark matter haloes in our models are more spherical than their counterparts in $\Lambda$CDM. The ReBEL haloes are also more virialised, with a large difference from $\Lambda$CDM for strong fifth forces and a much smaller change for weak scalar interactions.
Kapteyn Astronomical Institute, University of Groningen, P.O. Box 800, 9747 AV Groningen, The Netherlands

00008 The distribution of the halo triaxiality parameter $T$ in our six models.
00003 The distributions of the virial concentration parameter for all haloes in our \rebel models. Each panel shows also the fiducial \lcdm case for comparison.
00004 The mass-concentration relation. The median $c_{200}$ binned in halo mass is plotted for all models. The shaded region marks the bootstrap error of the median for the \lcdm case.

00000 Growth of the Fourier modes of density perturbations in the linear regime during the matter dominated era as predicted by \eq{eqn:growth_mode}. Solid black line depicts the \lcdm model with $\delta_k\propto t^{2/3}$ for all values of $k$. Solid, dotted and dashed red lines mark the growth of density perturbations in the \rebel model for $\beta=1$ and at three different values of $r_s\cdot k$. Both axes have arbitrary units.

00019 Comparison of the $z=0$ density $1+\delta$ for four out of the six considered models. The plots show the DM density in slices of $32\times32\times5 (\hmpc)^3$. The panels show the results for: a) LCDM, b) B01RS500, c) B05RS500\ and d) B05RS1000. The density is shown using a logarithmic colour scale that is the same for all the panels and is given on the right side of the plots.
00009 The distribution of the halo ellipticity parameter $e_1$ (top panel) and $e_2$ (bottom panel) in our six models.
00010 The distribution of the halo ellipticity parameter $e_1$ (top panel) and $e_2$ (bottom panel) in our six models.

00023 The dependence of the halo population on the Cosmic Web environment. The top-left panel shows the fraction of haloes at a given mass that is found in filaments, walls and voids for the LCDM run. The other three panels compare the halo fractions in filaments (top-right panel), walls (bottom-left panel) and voids (bottom-right panel) between \lcdm and the \rebel models.

00021 Left panel: A comparison of the \rebel cumulative mass function to that of the fiducial \lcdm model. The graph shows the ratio of the \rebel mass function with respect to the mass function found in the LCDM run. For clarity we show only the results for masses smaller than $10^{13}\Msol$ since for higher masses we have only a small number of haloes. Right panel: The cumulative mass function of haloes that reside within voids.

00022 Left panel: A comparison of the \rebel cumulative mass function to that of the fiducial \lcdm model. The graph shows the ratio of the \rebel mass function with respect to the mass function found in the LCDM run. For clarity we show only the results for masses smaller than $10^{13}\Msol$ since for higher masses we have only a small number of haloes. Right panel: The cumulative mass function of haloes that reside within voids.

00020 The $z=0$ filamentary environments as identified by the \nexus algorithm. The volume rendering represents the same volume as the density slices in \reffig{fig:dens_slices}. The panels show the filaments for: a) LCDM, b) B01RS500, c) B05RS500\ and d) B05RS1000. The lighter blue color shows where the filaments cut the plane of the selection box.
00001 The spherically averaged density profiles for the 10 Most Massive Haloes of the \lcdm and \rebel runs.
00002 The MMH10 density profiles shown separately, together with the best NFW fits.
00014 The distributions of the triaxiality parameter $T$ for haloes in our models.
00015 The distributions of the ellipticity parameter $e_1$for haloes in our models.
00016 The distributions of the ellipticity parameter $e_2$for haloes in our models.

00012 The distributions of the spin parameter accompanied by the fitted log-normal distributions. In each panel we also give the numerically computed mean value and the standard deviation for the distributions.
00011 Distributions of the spin parameter for all considered models.
00013 The $\lambda-M_{vir}$ correlation for all our models. For clarity the $1\sigma$ errors are plotted only for the \lcdm\ case.

00006 Comparison of the $z=0$ density slices for four out of six considered models. The panels show the DM density in slices $32\times32\times3.2 \hmpc$. The labels depict as follows: a) the LCDM run, b) the B05RS200 run, c) the B05RS1000 and d) stands for the B1RS1000 model.
00022 Comparison of the cross-correlated halo concentration parameter. The meaning of the lines is the same as in Fig.~\ref{fig:cc_mass}.
00019 Comparison of the cross-correlated halo masses in all considered models. The solid lines depict median values, while the errorbars mark the upper and lower quartiles.
00021 Comparison of the cross-correlated halo spin parameter. The meanings of lines is identical to Fig.~\ref{fig:cc_mass}.
00020 Comparison of the cross-correlated halo triaxiality parameter. The meanings of lines is identical to Fig.~\ref{fig:cc_mass}.
00009 The distributions of the virial concentration parameter for our \rebel models. In each panel we also plot for comparison the distribution of the \lcdm\ case.

00000 Growth of the Fourier modes of density perturbations in the linear regime during the matter-domination era as predicted by the equation \ref{eqn:growth_mode}. Solid black line depicts the \lcdm\ model with $\delta_k\propto t^{2/3}$ for all values of $k$. Solid, dotted and dashed red lines mark the growth of the $\delta_k$ in the \rebel\ model with $\beta=1$ and q the three different values of $r_s\cdot k$. Both axes have arbitrary units.
00007 The comparison of the averaged density profiles of 10 Most Massive Haloes between all our ReBEL models and the fiducial LCDM run.
00008 The MMH10 density profiles shown separately, together with the best NFW fits.

00010 The averaged haloes circular velocities binned in radial bins. The four panels show data for four classes of haloes depending on their virial radius: $15\hkpc\leq R_{vir}\leq50\hkpc$ (top-left), $50\hkpc < R_{vir}\leq 100\hkpc$ (top-right), $100\hkpc < R_{vir}\leq 300\hkpc$ (bottom-left) and $R_{vir}>300\hkpc$ (bottom-right). The curves were rescaled by the maximal $v_{circ}$ value for each DM halo (see text for the details).

00017 The virial ratios for haloes in all models. Panels show results from the \lcdm\ (top-left) to B1RS1000 (bottom-right). In each panel the points show results for individual haloes, where the solid black lines depict the median values computed in mass bins. Horizontal lines mark the virialisation threshold $\mathcal{V}=1$ (the dashed line) and the gravitational bound threshold $\mathcal{V}=2$ (the dotted line).

00018 Top panel: the median virial ratios for all models binned in halo mass. For clarity we plot the errorbars only for the \lcdm case, they represent the upper and lower quartiles of the sample. Bottom panel: The deviation of mass-binned virial ratios from the LCDM case $\Delta\mathcal{V}={\mathcal{V}_{ReBEL}/\mathcal{V}_{LCDM}}$ for the ReBEL models haloes.
00005 Distributions of the spin parameter $\lambda$ for our models.

00006 The distributions of the spin parameter accompanied by the fitted log-normal distributions. In each panel we also give the numerically computed mean value and the standard deviation of the shown distribution.

00007 The $\lambda-M_{200}$ correlation for all our models. The shaded region reflects the error in the determination of the median $\lambda$. For clarity the errors are plotted only for the \lcdm case.

00011 The virial ratios for haloes in all models. Panels show results from the \lcdm (top-left) to B1RS1000 (bottom-right). In each panel the points show results for individual haloes while the solid black lines depict the median values computed in each mass bin. Horizontal lines mark the virialisation threshold $\mathcal{V}=1$ (the dashed line) and the gravitational bound threshold $\mathcal{V}=2$ (the dotted line).

00012 Top panel: the median virial ratios for all models binned in halo mass. The error bars represent the upper and lower quartiles of the sample and are plotted only for the \lcdm case. Bottom panel: The deviation $\Delta\mathcal{V}={\mathcal{V}_{ReBEL}/\mathcal{V}_{LCDM}}$ of \rebel virial ratios $\mathcal{V}_{ReBEL}$ from the \lcdm case $\mathcal{V}_{LCDM}$.
